data.description: A human-readable error message.
The path in the code where the error occurred.
A stack trace of the error.
The type of the error.
Additional data related to the error.
Defines CORS whitelist. Use "*" to allow from any origin.
WASM only. Path to a custom `worker.js` file.
The numerator of the fractional value.
The denominator of the fractional value.
A decimal number as a string.
A standard [RationalValue](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/#rational-value) object.
A standard [FractionalValue](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/#fractional-value) object.
Offset for paginated results
Ignores any results prior to this UUID
Skips records until this UUID, excluding the record with this UUID. Convenient for infinite scrolling implementations.
Limits the number of returned swaps.
Returns limit swaps from the selected page. This parameter is ignored if from_uuid is set.

Optional, defaults to `10`/`5`. Interval in seconds between streaming event update requests. Defaults to `10` for [stream::balance::enable](/komodo-defi-framework/api/v20/streaming/balance_enable/) and `5` for [stream::network::enable](/komodo-defi-framework/api/v20/streaming/network_enable/)/[stream::heartbeat::enable](/komodo-defi-framework/api/v20/streaming/heartbeat_enable/)

[stream::network::enable](/komodo-defi-framework/api/v20/streaming/network_enable/) only. If `true`, network data will always be sent every `stream_interval_seconds`, even when there is no change. If `false`, network data will be sent regardless.
Interval in seconds between fee estimate updates.

If set to `Provider`, users must set the `gas_api` setting in their [MM2.json file](/komodo-defi-framework/setup/configure-mm2-json/) to source recommended fee values from third party providers [Infura](https://www.infura.io/) or [Blocknative](https://www.blocknative.com/) Used in [get_eth_estimated_fee_per_gas](/komodo-defi-framework/api/v20/streaming/fee_estimator/) only.
Current state of sync; possible values: `NotEnabled`, `NotStarted`, `InProgress`, `Error`, `Finished`

A standard [SyncStatusExtended](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/#sync-status-extended) object. Additional info that helps to track the progress; present for `InProgress` and `Error` states only.
Present for ETH/ERC20 coins only; displays the number of blocks left to be processed for `InProgress` state
Present for UTXO coins only; displays the number of transactions left to be processed for `InProgress` state
Displays the error code for `Error` state
Displays the error message for `Error` state
A list of chain IDs. For EIP155, refer to [https://chainid.network/](https://chainid.network/). For Cosmos, refer to [https://cosmos.directory/](https://cosmos.directory/)

A list of approved methods, usable while connected. For EIP155, refer to [https://docs.reown.com/advanced/multichain/rpc-reference/ethereum-rpc](https://docs.reown.com/advanced/multichain/rpc-reference/ethereum-rpc). For Cosmos, refer to [https://docs.reown.com/advanced/multichain/rpc-reference/cosmos-rpc](https://docs.reown.com/advanced/multichain/rpc-reference/cosmos-rpc)

A list of events to track during the connection. For EIP155, refer to [https://docs.reown.com/advanced/providers/ethereum#events](https://docs.reown.com/advanced/providers/ethereum#events). For Cosmos, refer to [https://tutorials.cosmos.network/academy/2-cosmos-concepts/10-events.html](https://tutorials.cosmos.network/academy/2-cosmos-concepts/10-events.html)
The session topic hex string, used to identify the session for communications with the external wallet/dapp.
Arbitrary data returned from the external wallet/dapp on connection.
The pairing topic hex string, used for the initial external wallet/dapp connection.

Contains the same two [WcConnNs](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/#wc-conn-ns) objects for Cosmos/EIP155 which were input when initialising the connection via [wc_new_connection](/komodo-defi-framework/api/v20-dev/wc_new_connection/#wc-new-connection).
A timestamp in [unix epoch format](https://www.epochconverter.com/) indicating when the connection will expire if not otherwise closed.
